@afchung I think something has gone wrong on this branch. I don't see the original commit anymore. Instead there are just two commits titled "Merged with upstream/master".

Also, changes to address the comments seem to be missing. For example, I still see instances of `@SuppressWarnings("unchecked") final` in the diff. Can you take another look?
The PR is going to be closed since we made another conclusion about how to address the issue through [JIRA-REEF-312](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-312)

@bgchun I want to double check something with you. The client retries even though the NameServer is local. I think this is by design, but I'm not sure. Is the idea that we're giving the evaluator being looked up a chance to re-register e.g., due to a failure and restart?

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #174](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/174/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
@afchung I did a pass. Mostly cosmetic (un-)changes.
@dafrista ping regarding my last comment :)

@markusweimer Thanks for the ping :)

I'm not sure we're on the same page. I'll give an example. A few things to note first:
- The User can set the process memory at the `EvaluatorAllocatedHandler`.
- The Runtime can set the process memory at the `ResourceLaunchHandler`. That's how the current runtimes use `jvmHeapSlack`.
- The flow is `EvaluatorAllocatedHandler -> submitTask -> ResourceLaunchHandler` so the User can set options in the process first, then the Runtime.

Now, let's look at example. The User code wants to set memory to `500`, while the JVMHeapSlack is set to `0.0` (the default value). Our RM (e.g. Yarn) returns a container of size `1000`.
1. If there is no "default" / "user" distinction
   - At `EvaluatorAllocatedHandler`: `setMemory(500)`: memory becomes `500`
   - At `ResourceLaunchHandler`: `setMemory(1.0 * 1000)`: memory becomes `1000`
2. Adding the "default" / "user" distiction
   - At `EvaluatorAllocatedHandler`: `setMemory(500)`: memory becomes `500`
   - At `ResourceLaunchHandler`: `setMemory(1.0 * 1000)`: memory remains `500`

From the user's point of view, I believe case 2 makes more sense. I'm not sure we can support backward compatibility (when the user doesn't setMemory at all and relies on heap slack) while also supporting setMemory without doing this split.

This pull request looks good
@markusweimer Addressed your comments, please have another pass. Thanks!
@afchung Thanks, I will do another pass now.
@afchung Done with my pass.
Is this PR deadlocked?

> The flow is `EvaluatorAllocatedHandler -> submitTask -> ResourceLaunchHandler` so the User can set options in the process first, then the Runtime.

Wouldn't it be "good enough" to just instruct the runtime authors not to create conflicting options? That is, `ResourceLaunchHandler` takes the user provided option if available and reverts to defaults if none is?
@shravanmn I believe this needs your review. Right after @jsjason has resolved the merge conflicts :-)

@markusweimer Updated and rebased. Please have another look. Note that the original DriverRestartConfiguration has been renamed and repurposed to DriverRuntimeRestartConfiguration, since it won't be exposed to the user. DriverRuntimeRestartConfiguration does not contain anything meaningful yet, but it will be used to bind the runtime-dependent handlers in REEF-483. The original DriverRestartHandlersConfiguration has been renamed to DriverRestartConfiguration and will be the  configuration module exposed to the user. Thanks!
@afchung Thanks! I will now do the next pass.
This looks good. I will test on my dev box and merge.
